original_title: 2,000 arrested for possession of drugs, directed to rehabilitation
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The National Dangerous Drugs Control Board says that about 2,000 people who were arrested for the possession of drugs have been directed for rehabilitation.
Its Assistant Director Pradeep Koholanegedara says that people who are arrested during drug sweeps are being sent for rehabilitation in this manner.
He adds that the majority of such individuals are being directed to the residential community treatment and rehabilitation process, due to the lack of room and facilities in rehabilitation centers.
Kohlanegedara says that accordingly, people who will be directed to domestic rehabilitation will be subjected to a monitoring process with the coordination of the police.
At the same time, a drug prevention program is also being implemented throughout the island.
